body_html: Just a report: my 980 Ti works fine on 100% load from mining (at 78 deg C with water cooling). So I'm not sure how it can be affected by a power source. Dne 18. 12. 2017 2:24 napsal uživatel "Pavel Surmenok" < notifications@github.com>: My solution was to replace a power supply with a better one. My machine works well with "Cooler Master V1000". — You are receiving this because you commented. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#8858 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAbOrOYG4LpG8YBWt8DZAkS_LOoBsR_Bks5tBWp-gaJpZM4MvKsu> .
body_text:
Just a report: my 980 Ti works fine on 100% load from mining (at 78 deg C
with water cooling). So I'm not sure how it can be affected by a power
source.

Dne 18. 12. 2017 2:24 napsal uživatel "Pavel Surmenok" <
notifications@github.com>:

My solution was to replace a power supply with a better one. My machine
works well with "Cooler Master V1000".

—

body:
Just a report: my 980 Ti works fine on 100% load from mining (at 78 deg C
with water cooling). So I'm not sure how it can be affected by a power
source.

Dne 18. 12. 2017 2:24 napsal uživatel "Pavel Surmenok" <
notifications@github.com>:

My solution was to replace a power supply with a better one. My machine
works well with "Cooler Master V1000".

—
